item.title: Fiber Is The New Wireline
item.description:
In the world of telecommunications, “wireline” traditionally refers to connections made through copper wires, while “wireless” implies no physical connections. However, “fiber optic” technology exists as a distinct category, utilizing physical cables but transmitting data through light rather than electricity. This distinction makes fiber optics a promising successor to the traditional copper wire infrastructure. Several factors contribute to fiber optic cable’s potential to replace copper wire. Interestingly, their structures share similarities...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/fiber-is-the-new-wireline/
